dublinCore.dc:title: 113 SRES 591 IS: Supporting the goals and ideals of American Education Week.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for Mrs. Hagan (for herself, Mr. Kirk, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Brown, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Ms. Mikulski, Ms. Baldwin, Mr. Durbin, Ms. Warren, Mr. Wyden, Mr. Cardin, and Mr. Levin)) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: Supporting the goals and ideals of American Education Week.

whereas.text: Whereas November 16 through November 22, 2014, marks the 93rd annual observance of American Education Week;

Whereas people working in the field of public education, whether teachers, higher education faculty and staff, paraeducators, custodians, substitute educators, bus drivers, clerical workers, food service professionals, workers in skilled trades, health and student service workers, security guards, technical employees, or librarians, work tirelessly to serve children and communities throughout the United States with care and professionalism; and
Whereas public schools are community linchpins, bringing together adults, children, educators, volunteers, business leaders, and elected officials in a common enterprise: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: supports the goals and ideals of American Education Week; and
encourages the people of the United States to observe American Education Week by reflecting on the positive impact of all individuals who work together to educate children.
